concepts/loader.title: Loaders
concepts/loader.description: The loader option is used to configure loaders, default being I18nJsonLoader. Currently I18nJsonLoader and I18nYamlLoader are supported out of the box.

concepts/resolver.title: Resolvers
concepts/resolver.description: The resolvers option is used to configure resolvers. The resolvers takes in array of resolvers so you can add in any number of resolvers you like.

guides/debugging.title: Debugging
guides/debugging.description: For debugging purposes if you specify the language as debug, nestjs-i18n will only return the translation key instead of the actual translation.

guides/dto_validation/global-validation.title: Global validation
guides/dto_validation/global-validation.description: To use nestjs-i18n in your DTO validation you first need to follow the nestjs instructions. After that you need to use the i18nValidationErrorFactory function in your ValidationPipe.

guides/dto_validation/manual-validation.title: Manual validation
guides/dto_validation/manual-validation.description: To manually validate DTO and get the I18nValidationError[] you can make use of the I18nContext or I18nService.

guides/exception-filters.title: Exception filters
guides/exception-filters.description: To access the I18nContext inside your exception filters use the getI18nContextFromArgumentsHost helper function.

guides/fallback-languages.title: Fallback languages
guides/fallback-languages.description: To configure one or more fallback languages use the fallbackLanguage and fallbacks options.

guides/formatting.title: Formatting
guides/formatting.description: nestjs-i18n uses string-format for formatting by default.

guides/graphql.title: GraphQL
guides/graphql.description: When using GraphQL nestjs-i18n works out of the box in most cases. With normal requests you can add headers etc. so the resolvers still work like you would expect. But when using GraphQL subscriptions this requires additional steps.

guides/grpc.title: gRPC
guides/grpc.description: When using a hybrid nestjs app the interceptors won't run on your grpc service out of the box. To fix this use the inheritAppConfig option when connecting your microservice.

guides/guard.title: Guards
guides/guard.description: To access the I18nContext inside your guards use the getI18nContextFromRequest helper function.

guides/mailer.title: Mailer
guides/mailer.description: To use nestjs-i18n with the @nestjs-modules/mailer package, you'll need to register the helper function like this:

guides/plurals.title: Plurals
guides/plurals.description: You can use plurals inside your translations as followed. You need to provide some of the listed categories required by your language rules Language Plural Rules. After finding your language in the table, check out the Type column. The cardinal type includes all plural categories you must implement. The next Example column will help you find out the correct form for each category.

guides/view_engines/ejs.title: ejs
guides/view_engines/ejs.description: To enable ejs support make use of the viewEngine option inside your I18nModule.

guides/view_engines/handlebars.title: Handlebars
guides/view_engines/handlebars.description: To enable handlebars support make use of the viewEngine option inside your I18nModule.

guides/view_engines/pug.title: Pug
guides/view_engines/pug.description: To enable pug support make use of the viewEngine option inside your I18nModule.

quick-start.title: Quickstart
quick-start.description: In this quick start you'll learn how to do a basic i18n setup.
